verb.description: Present and explain (a theory or idea) systematically and in detail.
examples: he was expounding a powerful argument
he declined to expound on his decision

origin: Middle English expoune (in the sense explain (what is difficult)): from Old French espon-, present tense stem of espondre, from Latin exponere expose, publish, explain, from ex- out + ponere put. The origin of the final -d (recorded from the Middle English period) is uncertain.
